multi_topic_discovery.topic_discovery_motivation: Impact: commodities; gold surged above $3,500 as Fed rate‑cut bets, higher Treasury yields, equity sell‑offs and tariff uncertainty drove safe‑haven demand.

category.motivation: The article analyzes how market participants are reacting to expectations of a Fed rate cut and the potential impact of the upcoming jobs report, which is a market commentary rather than a direct event or data release.

impact.motivation: The article reports a significant price surge in gold driven by macro factors (Fed rate cut expectations, rising Treasury yields, equity sell‑offs, tariff uncertainty), directly impacting the gold node.

time_frame.motivation: The article focuses on imminent Fed policy actions and short‑term market reactions affecting gold, indicating a near‑term impact.

article_node.title: Gold smashes $3,500 record as rate-cut bets, policy turmoil fuel haven rush
article_node.summary: Gold surged above $3,500 an ounce as traders bet the Fed will cut rates this month, with expectations of a first cut at the Sept. 16–17 meeting. The rally reflects safe‑haven demand amid rising Treasury yields, equity sell‑offs, and tariff uncertainty. Spot gold topped $3,508 in New York, while silver also climbed to $40 an ounce. The rally is expected to continue as the Fed signals easing policy and the next jobs report may confirm the direction.
